title.narrative: Multi purpose cash transfer program to support conflict affected people in South Kordofan - Kadugli

description.narrative: This emergency response require a rapid intervention to support the affected community to respond to the uncovered food related needs and other living expenses through cash voucher assistance (CVA) to enable affected households to meet their pressing needs due to the negative impact of the conflict in their livelihoods, inflation and high prices of food and commodities in the Kadugli market. Provision of CVA is intended to reduce distressed sale of assets by poor HHs to buy food and will help reduce of negative coping strategies. CVA supports local vendors, thus promoting the functioning of local markets. As a result of that, the main objective of the response is to improve food security conditions of the affected households therefore the cash program is linked to food security and accordingly the value of cash transfer or voucher has been calculated based on the value of the food basket. Cash is more affective in addressing multable needs due to the its flexibility but if cash transfer found not feasible due to liquidity issue or any other reason/(s), SC and World Vision will apply vouchers system. Vouchers ensures that families spend all the financial assistance they receive on food only. Vouchers also enable the organizations to regulate prices and avoid the negative impact of price rises that reduce the purchasing power of families. The proposed cash/voucher assistance will enable beneficiaries to buy dietary, diversified and favorite food as it is providing flexibility and a lot of food item options including milk.
